Make codebook for classcodes object

Source: R/codebook.R
codebook.Rd

Make codebook for classcodes object

codebook(object, coding, ..., file = NULL)

Arguments

object

classcodes object
coding

either a vector with codes from the original classification, or a name (character vector of length one) keyvalue object from package "decoder" (for example "icd10cm" or "atc")
...

Arguments passed on to summary.classcodes

cc_args

List of named arguments passed to set_classcodes()
file

name of Excel file for data export

Value

List of data frames describing relationship between groups and individual codes

See also

codebooks

Other classcodes: all_classcodes(), as.data.frame.classified(), classcodes, codebooks(), print.codebook(), print.summary.classcodes(), set_classcodes(), summary.classcodes(), visualize.classcodes()

Examples

# All codes from ICD-10-CM used by Elixhauser
codebook(elixhauser, "icd10cm")

#> Classification based on: icd10
#> Coodebooks are prefarably exported to Excel using the `file` argument! Use `summary.classcodes()` or `visualize()` for interactive summaries!
#> Preview of README sheet specifying columns in following sheets:
#> 
#> # A tibble: 6 x 3
#>   tab       column      description                                       
#>   <chr>     <chr>       <chr>                                             
#> 1 summary   group       Group to categorize by                            
#> 2 summary   n           Number of identified codes contained in this group
#> 3 summary   codes       Comma separated list of individual codes in group 
#> 4 all_codes code        Individual code                                   
#> 5 all_codes description Description of individual code                    
#> 6 all_codes group       Group to categorize by                            
#> 
#> 
#> Preview of summary sheet:
#> 
#> # A tibble: 31 x 3
#>    group                   n codes                                              
#>    <chr>               <int> <chr>                                              
#>  1 AIDS/HIV                1 B20                                                
#>  2 alcohol abuse         131 E52, F1010, F1011, F10120, F10121, F10129, F1014, ~
#>  3 blood loss anemia       1 D500                                               
#>  4 cardiac arrhythmias    73 I441, I442, I4430, I4439, I456, I459, I470, I471, ~
#>  5 chronic pulmonary ~    69 I27812, I27822, I27832, I27892, I2792, J40, J410, ~
#>  6 coagulopathy           27 D65, D66, D67, D680, D681, D682, D68311, D68312, D~
#>  7 congestive heart f~    36 I099, I1101, I1301, I1321, I255, I420, I425, I4261~
#>  8 deficiency anemia      17 D508, D509, D510, D511, D512, D513, D518, D519, D5~
#>  9 depression             31 F3130, F3131, F3132, F314, F3152, F320, F321, F322~
#> 10 diabetes complicat~   243 E1021, E1022, E1029, E10311, E10319, E103211, E103~
#> # ... with 21 more rows
#> 
#> 
#> Preview of all_codes:
#> 
#> # A tibble: 3,127 x 3
#>    code  description                                   group           
#>    <chr> <chr>                                         <chr>           
#>  1 A5200 Cardiovascular syphilis, unspecified          valvular disease
#>  2 A5201 Syphilitic aneurysm of aorta                  valvular disease
#>  3 A5202 Syphilitic aortitis                           valvular disease
#>  4 A5203 Syphilitic endocarditis                       valvular disease
#>  5 A5204 Syphilitic cerebral arteritis                 valvular disease
#>  6 A5205 Other cerebrovascular syphilis                valvular disease
#>  7 A5206 Other syphilitic heart involvement            valvular disease
#>  8 A5209 Other cardiovascular syphilis                 valvular disease
#>  9 B180  Chronic viral hepatitis B with delta-agent    liver disease   
#> 10 B181  Chronic viral hepatitis B without delta-agent liver disease   
#> # ... with 3,117 more rows

# All codes from ICD-9-CM Disease part used by Elixhauser enhanced version
codebook(elixhauser, "icd9cmd",
  cc_args = list(regex = "icd9cm_enhanced")
)

#> Coodebooks are prefarably exported to Excel using the `file` argument! Use `summary.classcodes()` or `visualize()` for interactive summaries!
#> Preview of README sheet specifying columns in following sheets:
#> 
#> # A tibble: 6 x 3

#> 2 summary   n           Number of identified codes contained in this group
#> 3 summary   codes       Comma separated list of individual codes in group 
#> 4 all_codes code        Individual code                                   
#> 5 all_codes description Description of individual code                    
#> 6 all_codes group       Group to categorize by                            
#> 
#>
